name: Fruit Salad
description: Colorful fresh seasonal fruits with light honey-lemon dressing. Refreshing and vibrant.

instructions.instruction: Gently wash all fruits under cold water.
instructions.tip: Fruits should be fresh and cold.

instructions.instruction: Hull strawberries. Halve or quarter depending on size.
Cut mango in half around the pit. Score flesh and scoop out cubes.
instructions.tip: Ripe mango is sweet and creamy.

instructions.instruction: Peel kiwis. Slice into half-moon shapes.
Peel oranges. Remove white pith and separate into segments.
instructions.tip: Save any juice that drips - add to dressing.

instructions.instruction: Place all prepared fruits in large serving bowl.
Make dressing: Whisk honey, lemon juice, and zest in small bowl.
instructions.tip: Microwave honey for a few seconds if too thick.

instructions.instruction: Serve immediately or chill 30 minutes in refrigerator.

tips: Use seasonal fruits for freshest and most economical choice.
Don't add banana - it browns quickly and changes texture.
Citrus acid prevents other fruits from browning.
Perfect for parties - easy but impressive.
Serve for breakfast, dessert, or as side dish.
storageInfo: Refrigerate covered 1-2 days. Fruits release more juice daily.
servingSuggestion: Serve with yogurt, ice cream, or alone. Brunch table essential.
variations: Tropical: Mango, pineapple, papaya, and coconut.
Red berries: Only red fruits - strawberries, raspberries, cherries.
Chocolate drizzle: Top with chocolate sauce.
With granola: Add granola for breakfast version.
